title: Caretaker govt adviser Fazlur Rahman dies
body: Kazi Fazlur Rahman, an adviser to the country’s first caretaker government, passed away at his resident in Dhaka on Saturday. He was 93. The eminent educationist, administrator, social worker, and litterateur Fazlur Rahman died from his age-related complications, said a press release. In the post-independence Bangladesh, he held the positions of secretary to the Ministry of Petroleum and Mineral Resources and the Ministry of Education. Before retirement, he was a member of the Planning Commission with the status of Cabinet Secretary. Beyond his national responsibilities, Fazlur Rahman served various international development organisations, including the World Bank and the Asian Development Bank. He served as chairperson of the Radda MCH–FP Centre, a non-profit child and mother healthcare institute, from its inception. Fazlur Rahman authored three novels, six Bengali short story books, one English short story collection, and a five-volume diary series published in national newspapers.
